examples: The hot summer day made it unbearable for David to wear clothes, so he decided to spend the afternoon in the buff, sunbathing in his backyard.

- I think, just life was so unbearable in North Korea.
If it is next door, it's absolutely unbearable.
words.defineEn: incapable of being tolerated or endured
words.defineVi: không có khả năng chịu đựng hoặc chịu đựng

examples: Obviously myself, our other senior campaign spokespeople tried to counterattack, tried to argue to the American people that this was not just unbecoming of a presidential campaign, but was downright dangerous.
words.defineEn: not in keeping with accepted standards of what is right or proper in polite society

examples: He's unbridled.

words.defineVi: không bị hạn chế hoặc kiểm soát

examples: The ex-employee made unfounded accusations against their former boss in the hopes that it would make them look like a victim,, believing in the saying throw dirt enough, and some will stick.

examples: And it's just inconceivable that any fair transaction could have transpired during this period of time.

examples: Once the toxins work their way out of your system, you should start to feel the nausea subside and your energy return.

examples: For one, when we looked at the aftermath of the Civil War and the resurrection of a movement to reinscribe slavery, indeed, Ulysses S. Grant was confronted with having to uproot the Ku Klux Klan.

examples: They have been resurgent since the drawdown of peak U.S. forces in 2011, and today they control or contest more more territory across Afghanistan than at any other time in recent history.
